problems.title: Problem 5
problems.content: The current i<sub>0</sub> in the circuit in (Figure 1) is <input id='p5-I0' type='number' /> A and the voltage v<sub>g</sub> is <input id='p5-Vg' type='number' /> V

parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Find the power dissipated in each resistor.
parts.need: Express your answers in watts to three significant figures. Enter your answers in descending order separated by commas.

parts.title: Part C
parts.content: Find the power developed by the <input type='number' /> V source.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

problems.title: Problem 6
problems.content: The voltage across the 22.5 Ω resistor in the circuit in (Figure 1) is <input id='p6-Vr' type='number' /> V, and positive at the upper terminal; the source voltage is <input id='p6-Vg' type='number' /> V.

parts.content: Find the power dissipated in each resistor.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Find the power supplied by the 248 V ideal voltage source.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Find the power dissipated in each resistor.

parts.content: Find v<sub>1</sub> and v<sub>g</sub> in the circuit shown in the figure when v<sub>o</sub> equals <input id='p10-V0' type='number' /> V. (Hint: Start at the right end of the circuit and work back toward v<sub>g</sub>).
